body:
For merge after v0.15

Makes the bitcoin-cli interface for using multiwallet friendlier by removing `-usewallet`. To specify which wallet to call on a multiwallet node, users should specify `-wallet` on the command line. bitcoin-cli will ignore `-wallet` arguments in bitcoin.conf. Behaviour is as follows:

- if bitcoin.conf has no `-wallet` argument, bitcoind will launch with the default `wallet.dat` wallet
    - with no `-wallet` command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs  to the `/` URI path. bitcoind will select the `wallet.dat` wallet (as only one wallet is loaded). **Backwards compatible behaviour**
    - with a `-wallet=wallet.dat`, command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs to the `/wallet/wallet.dat/` URI path.
- if bitcoin.conf has one `-wallet=<wallet>` argument, bitcoind will launch with the specified `<wallet>`
    - with no `-wallet` command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs  to the `/` URI path. bitcoind will select the `<wallet>` wallet (as only one wallet is loaded). **Backwards compatible behaviour**
    - with a `-wallet=<wallet>`, command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs to the `/wallet/<wallet>/` URI path.
- if bitcoin.conf has multiple `wallet` arguments, bitcoind will launch with multiple wallets
    - with no `-wallet` command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs  to the `/` URI path. bitcoind will reject the request, since no wallet was specified.
    - with a `-wallet=<wallet>`, command line argument bitcoin-cli will send RPCs  to the specified `/wallet/<wallet>/` URI path.

if multiple `-wallet` arguments are provided on the command line, bitcoin-cli will reject the request on the client side.
title: Remove -usewallet
